alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 6:54PM MST until February 21 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SUNDAY TO 5 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches, including over Lolo Pass and Lost Trail Pass. Higher amounts of up to 2 feet in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches possible, with up to 20 inches over Lolo and Lost Trail Passes. Blowing and drifting snow, dangerously cold wind chills and a freeze up on roadways is possible Tuesday evening with an arctic front passage. * WHERE...Bitterroot/Sapphire Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 PM Sunday to 5 AM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
